soc.server.savegame

Class GameSaverJSON

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.server.savegame.GameSaverJSON

  • public class GameSaverJSON
extends java.lang.Object
    Save a game and its board's current state to a JSON file. Game state must be GameState.ROLL_OR_CARD or higher. Uses SavedGameModel, including some custom field serializers declared through its @JsonAdapter field annotations.
    Since:
    2.3.00
    Author:
    Jeremy D Monin <jeremy@nand.net>
    See Also:
    GameLoaderJSON

    • Method Detail

      • saveGame

        public static void saveGame(SOCGame ga,
                            java.io.File saveDir,
                            java.lang.String saveFilename,
                            SOCServer srv)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                            SavedGameModel.UnsupportedSGMOperationException,
                            java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                            java.io.IOException
        Save this game to a JSON file.

        Assumes caller has checked that gson jar is on classpath by calling Class.forName("com.google.gson.Gson") or similar.

        Parameters:
        ga - Game to save; not null
        saveDir - Existing directory into which to save the file
        saveFilename - Filename to save as; recommended suffix is FILENAME_EXTENSION
        srv - Server, for game/player info lookups; not null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if saveDir isn't a currently existing directory
        SavedGameModel.UnsupportedSGMOperationException - if game has an option or feature not yet supported by SavedGameModel; see SavedGameModel.checkCanSave(SOCGame) for details.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if game state < GameState.ROLL_OR_CARD
        java.io.IOException - if a problem occurs while saving
